definitions.definition: ( business ) The loss or return of performance-related compensation originally paid by an employer to an employee as a result of the discovery of a defect in the performance .
examples: When bank fired the loan originator, they recovered the last two years of her bonuses under the malus clause in her contract.

definitions.definition: ( rare ) A penalty or negative thing.

main_definition: ( business ) The loss or return of performance-related compensation originally paid by an employer to an employee as a result of the discovery of a defect in the performance .
secondary_definitions: ( rare ) A penalty or negative thing.

definitions.definition: A plant of the genus Malus (the apples ).

main_definition: A plant of the genus Malus (the apples ).
